MAST.utility.metadata module¶

class MAST.utility.metadata.Metadata(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: MAST.utility.mastobj.MASTObj

Class to handle the metadata file Fields are composed of a keyword and a value, separated by a ‘=’.

clear_data(keyword)[source]¶

Removes the specified data and keyword from the file. This is inefficient, as what we do is basically reading in the file then iterating through the file, do if..else check, clear the file, then re-write it.

But it works!

clear_file()[source]¶

Empties the metafile

read_data(keyword)[source]¶

Searches the metadata file for a specific keyword and returns the data.

search_data(keyword)[source]¶

Searches the file for a keyword, and if found returns the line number and data for that keyword. Returns:

[line_number, data] line_number <int>: line number found data <str>: data found
write_data(keyword, data)[source]¶

Writes a keyword and its associated data to the metafile
